author: Max Watman
title: Southern food and Southern Charm
text:
The best stories come from the South. I’m even a little surprised when I learn of a good one from elsewhere—“Well, bless his heart! Ketchum, you say?” I’m kidding, but I could be serious. The big cultural, gustatory and musical narratives of America all run through the South, and the fact that other regions can make a claim here or there doesn’t change the facts. Southerners do not let this go unnoted.
Lots of those stories are about food, of course, and as Rick Bragg is out to prove in his book “The Best Cook in the World”...
